block.p: Suzanne Caroline Swift, a daughter of Phyllis and Albert M. Swift of Douglaston, Queens, was married on Friday to James Donley Wilson, the son of Ruth Wilson McCorkle of Crossville, Tenn., and the late James Wilson. Rabbi Michael Tillman officiated at Cafe Brauer in Chicago.

The bride, 31, owns Info Edge, a consulting company in New York for architects and interior designers, and SpecSimple.com, a Web site that helps designers find materials. She and the bridegroom graduated from Yale University. Her parents are lawyers in Great Neck, N.Y.

Suzanne Caroline Swift, a daughter of Phyllis and Albert M. Swift of Douglaston, Queens, was married on Friday to James Donley Wilson, the son of Ruth Wilson McCorkle of Crossville, Tenn., and the late James Wilson. Rabbi Michael Tillman officiated at Cafe Brauer in Chicago.

The bride, 31, owns Info Edge, a consulting company in New York for architects and interior designers, and SpecSimple.com, a Web site that helps designers find materials. She and the bridegroom graduated from Yale University. Her parents are lawyers in Great Neck, N.Y.

The bridegroom, 33, is a design engineer at H Power Inc., a manufacturer of hydrogen fuel cells in Belleville, N.J. He received a master's degree in mechanical engineering from the University of Texas at Austin. His mother retired as the director of underwriting at the Chicago Mutual Liability Company. His father retired as a mechanical engineer at Skidmore, Owings & Merrill, the architectural firm in Chicago.
